dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: People think international diplomacy is all about big summits, but actually, a lot of it happens through these personal messages—like President Tokayev's telegram to Georgia.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: People think international diplomacy is all about big summits, but actually, a lot of it happens through these personal messages-like President Tokayev's telegram to Georgia.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, and he specifically mentioned their 9.4% economic growth rate from earlier this year. That's uh, pretty impressive for any country right now.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, and he specifically mentioned their nine point four percent economic growth rate from earlier this year. That's uh, pretty impressive for any country right now.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: At that time, the President of Kazakhstan praised Georgia's dynamic progress in recent years, noting the impressive results of ongoing reforms and an economic growth rate of 9.4%.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Exactly. And he praised Georgia's democratic institutions too—it's not just about economics; it's about governance as well.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Exactly. And he praised Georgia's democratic institutions too-it's not just about economics; it's about governance as well.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: In his message, Tokayev highlighted Georgia's significant achievements in strengthening democratic institutions, modernizing the economy, and improving the well-being of its citizens.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Right, and he called them a reliable partner in the Caucasus, which is a pretty strategic region. That's not just diplomatic fluff.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Right, and he called them a reliable partner in the Caucasus, which is a pretty strategic region. That's not just diplomatic fluff.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Tokayev highly valued the comprehensive development of Kazakh-Georgian relations, stating that Georgia is a reliable partner of Kazakhstan in the Caucasus region, with whom the country shares strong bonds of friendship and historical ties.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: No, and there's history there—he mentioned their historical ties, which adds depth to the relationship beyond just current politics.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: No, and there's history there-he mentioned their historical ties, which adds depth to the relationship beyond just current politics.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Tokayev highly valued the comprehensive development of Kazakh-Georgian relations, stating that Georgia is a reliable partner of Kazakhstan in the Caucasus region, with whom the country shares strong bonds of friendship and historical ties.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Plus, Tokayev was invited to visit Georgia by their Prime Minister, Irakli Kobakhidze. That suggests things are moving in a positive direction.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Plus, Tokayev was invited to visit Georgia by their Prime Minister, Irakli Kobakhidze. That suggests things are moving in a positive direction.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Earlier, the head of the Georgian government had invited President Tokayev to visit Georgia.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: For sure. And this isn't the first contact—they had talks back in February, so there's already some momentum building.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: For sure. And this isn't the first contact-they had talks back in February, so there's already some momentum building.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Notably, in February of this year, Tokayev held talks with Georgian Prime Minister Irakli Kobakhidze.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: It's interesting how these smaller gestures, like congratulating on Independence Day, can reinforce bigger diplomatic goals.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: It's interesting how these smaller gestures, like congratulating on Independence Day, can reinforce bigger diplomatic goals.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Absolutely. And framing it as "friendly people" and "shared bonds"—that's classic soft diplomacy at work.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Absolutely. And framing it as friendly people and shared bonds-that's classic soft diplomacy at work.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Kassym-Jomart Tokayev wished Mikheil Kavelashvili every success in his responsible public service and extended his best wishes to the friendly people of Georgia for continued progress and prosperity.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Makes you wonder what might come next—maybe a state visit or even some bilateral agreements down the line.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Makes you wonder what might come next-maybe a state visit or even some bilateral agreements down the line.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Could be. Tokayev seems invested in that relationship, given how specific his praise was.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Could be. Tokayev seems invested in that relationship, given how specific his praise was.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, he didn't just say "good job"—he pointed to concrete things like modernization and citizen well-being.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, he didn't just say good job-he pointed to concrete things like modernization and citizen well-being.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: In his message, Tokayev highlighted Georgia's significant achievements in strengthening democratic institutions, modernizing the economy, and improving the well-being of its citizens.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Right, which makes the message feel more genuine and less like a formality.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Right, which makes the message feel more genuine and less like a formality.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Definitely. It's a small thing, but it matters in building trust between nations.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Definitely. It's a small thing, but it matters in building trust between nations.
